meanings.definition: A person chosen or appointed to act or speak on behalf of others.
meanings.sent1: The student council president is a representative of the student body.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a representative to negotiate with the union.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot jokingly claimed to be the representative of all birds.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood tall, a representative of safety and guidance for sailors.
meanings.sent5: The statue in the town square serves as a representative of freedom and democracy.

meanings.definition: Typical of a particular group or class.
meanings.sent1: Her behavior was representative of the kindness found in our community.
meanings.sent2: The traditional dress was representative of their cultural heritage.
meanings.sent3: The clown's serious expression was not representative of his usual antics.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree was representative of strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The colorful mural was representative of the artist's unique style.

meanings.definition: Serving as a symbol or example of something.
meanings.sent1: The historic building is a representative landmark of the city.
meanings.sent2: The red rose is representative of love and passion.
meanings.sent3: The broken clock humorously became representative of the concept of 'time flies'.
meanings.sent4: The lone wolf is often seen as representative of independence and solitude.
meanings.sent5: The bright star in the sky was a representative beacon of hope for the lost travelers.
